text: In a statement, FEC Commissioner @EllenLWeintraub, who voted to investigate the matter further, asks why it took so long to reach this point, arguing that tardiness in reaching a conclusion is "an abject failure of the FEC’s responsibility to the public" http://bit.ly/2FtOfho
author: mjbeckel

text: .@CampaignLegal & @FredWertheimer alleged that Santorum, long before he announced his intention to explore a run for president, used a PAC and 501(c)(4) group to pay for activities that should have been paid for using $ raised under FECA limitations (and reported to the FEC)
author: mjbeckel

text: In non-Mueller-related news... @FEC today announced it deadlocked 2-2 in complaint brought against Rick Santorum in March 2015 by @CampaignLegal & @FredWertheimer over "testing the waters" issues http://bit.ly/2WgYJ9l
author: mjbeckel

text: At first glance to me, it looks like this @OpenSecretsDC tool is built using whatever numbers candidates report to the @FEC for their unitemized donors (i.e., donors who give less than $200)
author: mjbeckel

text: Oh neat! New @OpenSecretsDC tool highlights money members of Congress have raised from small-dollar donors — making it easy to sort by amount or by percentage of all receipts! https://bit.ly/2HOOzJg
author: mjbeckel

text: Will a new federal court ruling lead to more scam PACs? @JessicaTaylor of @NPR explores that question, and cites my 2015 @Publici story about a shady Bernie Sanders-branded super PAC that bilked scores of donors, including "James Bond" actor Daniel Craig
author: mjbeckel

text: For the sake of the country, House leaders need to modernize Congress, writes @IOMcGehee in @thehill
author: mjbeckel

text:
#campaignfinance enforcement news via @TheJusticeDept: A Rhode Island man who operated two scam PACs — raising $1M+ that he used to pay for escorts, plane tickets, and more — has pleaded guilty to fraud http://bit.ly/2TOKHPs   

Background via @MRSmithAP https://abcn.ws/2Ju88ZO
author: mjbeckel

text: Tobacco-funded #darkmoney group mysteriously turns up in Phoenix mayoral race, reports @lachlan @thedailybeast https://bit.ly/2JEdr98  #phxmayor
author: mjbeckel

text: "There is an unmistakable bipartisan hunger from within to make Congress work better," writes @IOMcGehee of @IssueOneReform about the #FixCongress Select Committee on Modernization http://ow.ly/sJFS30o8oYW
author: mjbeckel

text: Small-dollar donors could transform the 2020 presidential campaign, reports @christacbryant @csmonitor
author: mjbeckel

text: How small-dollar donors may transform the political landscape in 2020, via @christacbryant of @csmonitor, citing @IssueOneReform, @MichaelMalbin of @cfinst_org @MoneyInPolitics & @Burgwinkle of  @StopBigMoney http://ow.ly/mNAz30o7WIl
author: mjbeckel

text: "In life, there are some people who have more money, there are some people who have less money. But everybody should have an equal share of our democracy," @ewarren tells @mj_lee @CNN
author: mjbeckel

text: Bombshell @nytimes investigation re: potential straw donors to Trump's campaign by @FrancesRobles @PekingMike & @jotted contains some gems based on analyzing #FEC data — underscoring how sometimes outliers in #campaignfinance data may lead to great stories https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/16/us/cindy-yang-trump-donations.html …
author: mjbeckel

text: The idea of reforming the #FEC and creating a blue ribbon panel to help select new commissioners has bipartisan support on Capitol Hill, see #HR1272 introduced by lead sponsors @RepDerekKilmer & @RepBrianFitz last month https://kilmer.house.gov/news/press-releases/kilmer-fitzpatrick-introduce-bipartisan-bill-to-fix-americas-election-watchdog …
author: mjbeckel

text: One big issue contributing to the dysfunction at the @FEC? Commissioners are "hand-picked by the people they are regulating," says #FEC Chair @EllenLWeintraub at @PressClubDC. One idea to change this: a blue ribbon panel that puts forward names of qualified commissioners
author: mjbeckel

text: One reason cases take so long to resolve, says @FEC Chair @EllenLWeintraub at @PressClubDC: More cases and fewer lawyers to handle them. "We could use another whole team of enforcement attorneys," she says
author: mjbeckel

text: At @PressClubDC, @FEC  Chair @EllenLWeintraub says it would be ideal for #FEC complaints to be resolved during the same election cycle they are filed: "I am deeply concerned about the time that cases take," she adds
author: mjbeckel

text: "Our coordination rules are inadequate to deal with the current landscape" of single-candidate super PACs working closely with the candidates they are supposed to be independent from, says @FEC Chair @EllenLWeintraub at @PressClubDC. "That's a big problem."
author: mjbeckel

text:
Question from a reporter to @FEC Chair @EllenLWeintraub at @PressClubDC: What is the #FEC doing to combat foreign influence in US elections?

The short answer, says @EllenLWeintraub: "Not enough"
author: mjbeckel

text: After coding and cleaning happens, then candidate profiles on http://OpenSecrets.org  will be updated to showcase update analysis based on itemized contribution records, such as top donors, top industries, geography, etc
author: mjbeckel

text: At @PressClubDC @skrmhlz notes that summary data on candidate profiles (eg, money raised, spent, cash on hand) are updated daily on http://OpenSecrets.org  but adds that @OpenSecretsDC staffers spend weeks coding & cleaning itemized transaction records before that data is updated
author: mjbeckel

text: At @PressClubDC, @anitakumar01 notes that @fec always has the data first, while endorsing @OpenSecretsDC has a resource that makes it easier for reporters to make sense of #campaignfinance data and trends
author: mjbeckel

text:
Care about tracking $$ in politics? 

Next #campaignfinance filing deadline for congressional & presidential candidates is April 15

Want the data fastest, go to http://FEC.gov  & search for individual reports

@ProPublica's tool also great:

https://projects.propublica.org/itemizer/
author: mjbeckel
mjbeckel

text: Advice for following the money and using #campaignfinance data from @skrmhlz of @OpenSecretsDC at @PressClubDC: "You can find gold in the data if you are willing to mine it" More tips from @OpenSecretsDC here:
author: mjbeckel

text: Political fundraisers haven't always been closed to the press and shouldn't be, says @anitakumar01 of @politico at @PressClubDC, imploring reporters to show the public what gets said at, and who attends, 2020 presidential fundraising events
author: mjbeckel

text: The recent #FEC fines against Chinese-owned American Pacific International Capital and pro-Jeb Bush Right to Rise super PAC "should be a shot across the bow" that foreign nationals cannot be using outside groups to influence US elections says @EllenLWeintraub at @PressClubDC
author: mjbeckel

text: At @PressClubDC, @FEC Commissioner @EllenLWeintraub implores reporters to follow the money. "You could be the author of the next story that leads to a $1 million penalty," she continues citing recent #FEC fine spurred by @lhfang @schwarz   @theintercept
author: mjbeckel

text: Another way that #darkmoney has increasingly flowed into elections: Opaque limited liability companies, as I detailed in this investigation at @Publici
author: mjbeckel

text: Last year @IssueOneReform profiled the 15 top-spending #darkmoney groups and published a searchable, sortable, downloadable database detailing contributions to dark money groups from more than 400 donors and donor organizations https://www.issueone.org/dark-money/  cc @PressClubDC
author: mjbeckel

text: Political #darkmoney "continues to be an area of concern," says @FEC Commissioner @EllenLWeintraub at @PressClubDC. "People keep finding ways around disclosure rules."
author: mjbeckel

text: Why should reporters pay attention to #campaignfinance data? Money in politics "affects everything" says @fec Commissioner @EllenLWeintraub at @PressClubDC. Money affects "who gets elected" and "what gets enacted," she continues.
author: mjbeckel

text: How has e-filing #campaignfinance reports changed things? The public and the press now has access to all the information filed in senators’ campaign finance reports as soon as they are filed with the @FEC http://ow.ly/XT7z30o3HJi  h/t @OpenSecretsDC #SunshineWeek
author: mjbeckel

text:
New #campaignfinance analysis from @FEC:

Super PACs & "hybrid" super PACs raised more than $3 billion during the 2017-2018 election cycle

House & Senate candidates raised about $2.8 billion

https://bit.ly/2Jcu2jU
author: mjbeckel

text:
New #campaignfinance analysis from @FEC:

PACs associated with corporations & trade associations raised about $600 million during the 2017-2018 election cycle

PACs associated with labor unions raised about $370 million

https://bit.ly/2Jcu2jU
author: mjbeckel
